item.title: We Began to Forget: Public Morozov Anti-Pattern
item.description: I decided to start new series of blogs called “We Began to Forget”. The idea is simple and a little melancholic. Software engineering has a short memory, patterns get discovered and then forgotten, lessons get relearned. These posts are small memory refreshers about important aspects of our craft with a strong focus on clever hacks rather than things you can read in clever books. Books will make sure the good patterns will live on, but tribal knowledge has to be passed by word of mouth.
